items.text: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.

items.text: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!
items.plainText: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!

items.text: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
items.plainText: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.

items.text: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.
items.plainText: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.

items.text: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
items.plainText: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

items.text: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
items.plainText: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.

items.text: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.
items.plainText: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

items.text: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.
items.plainText: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.

items.text: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
items.plainText: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

items.text: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
items.plainText: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

items.text: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
items.plainText: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

items.text: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
items.plainText: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

items.text: O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
items.plainText: O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
